text: Sardar Asif Ahmad Ali Daula (21 October 1940 - 19 May 2022) was a Pakistani politician. He was the 18th Foreign Minister of Pakistan from 1993 to 1996. He was a senior member of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf and Pakistan Peoples Party. He was elected to the National Assembly of Pakistan from Kasur in 1994 and again in 2008."Kasur, Pollution Profile", IUCN National Conservation Strategy Bulletin 6.1, January 1994, p. 7, pdf p. 3 He also was the Minister for Education and Federal Minister of Information Technology and Telecommunication between 2008 and 2010. Daula died on 19 May 2022 at the age of 81.Former Foreign Minister Sardar Asif Ali passes away ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Politicians from Punjab, Pakistan
title: Aseff Ahmad Daula
